rationales.hedonism: She spent the evening comparing fixed deposits instead of booking the Alibaug trip she and Anil had planned, repeatedly deferring pleasure for financial responsibility.
rationales.stimulation: The Alibaug weekend trip was pushed again and again — school fees, glasses, Diwali — and the saved dates sit in her calendar 'like some kind of joke,' reflecting her avoidance of any break from routine.
rationales.self_direction: She deferred to Anil's judgment that they should lock in the rate, spending her evening on bank comparison sites rather than pursuing what she actually wanted.
rationales.benevolence: She managed the household finances and compared fixed deposits while the kids fought over the remote, putting family financial security ahead of her own desires.
rationales.conformity: She agreed with Anil's financial priorities without pushing back, accepting the practical choice over the trip she wanted.
rationales.security: She spent the evening comparing fixed deposit rates to lock in before they drop, prioritizing financial stability over the vacation she had been hoping for.

rationales.hedonism: Her sister's comment about the Lonavala trip 'not counting' highlights how consistently Priya has been denied real leisure and enjoyment.
rationales.self_direction: She pushed back against her sister's judgment, asserting 'I do not need her opinion on how we spend our time or money' — defending her right to define her own choices.
rationales.conformity: She bristled at her sister's social judgment rather than accepting it, resisting the external evaluation of her lifestyle choices.

rationales.hedonism: She watched her show and ate leftover gulab jamun after a full day of caregiving, but the quiet evening 'should have felt peaceful but it just felt flat' — her small pleasures aren't fulfilling.
rationales.benevolence: She took the children for dental checkups, made dinner, helped Aarav with homework, and arranged a tuition teacher — a full day devoted to her family's needs.
rationales.conformity: She kept Anil's food covered and waited without complaint when he came home late, ate while scrolling, and went straight to bed, maintaining the household routine without disruption.
rationales.security: She felt relief that there were no cavities because the last round cost eleven thousand rupees, and arranged affordable tuition for Aarav's Hindi, managing the family's financial and educational stability.

rationales.hedonism: She articulated wanting small pleasures — the Goa resort, good cheese without guilt, an auto instead of the bus — 'small things that do not require a committee meeting.'
rationales.stimulation: She pushed for spending money on experiences and enjoyment rather than continuing the pattern of only saving, seeking a break from the financial routine.
rationales.self_direction: She directly challenged Anil's and his mother's financial priorities, asking 'at what point do we stop saving for some imagined disaster and use the money to actually live a little?'
rationales.tradition: She rejected her mother-in-law's traditional insistence on gold investment, dismissing the cultural expectation that 'every family needs gold as a safety net.'
rationales.conformity: She openly disagreed with Anil after smiling through lunch with his mother, telling him she doesn't want more gold sitting in a locker, causing him to go quiet.
rationales.security: She questioned the family's security-first approach, arguing they already have insurance, FD, and provident fund, and pushing to redirect resources toward living rather than continued saving.

rationales.power: She sat on the kitchen floor crying, feeling powerless as her days 'dissolve into errands and appointments and packed lunches' with nothing left for herself.
rationales.achievement: She contrasts her former competence — coordinating events for two hundred guests with spreadsheets and timelines — with her inability to order a cake on time, revealing a deep sense of lost capability.
rationales.hedonism: She recognizes that 'even when it goes right, there is nothing in it for me,' with the party serving everyone's needs except her own enjoyment.
rationales.self_direction: She paid double for the cake without consulting Anil and didn't assert her own needs when he failed to notice her distress, unable to claim space for herself.
rationales.benevolence: She called four bakeries and paid nearly double to ensure Rhea gets her castle cake, prioritizing her daughter's happiness above all else.
rationales.conformity: She told Anil the original bakery 'fell through' rather than revealing her mistake or her emotional breakdown, managing the situation to maintain household harmony.

rationales.achievement: She successfully pulled off Rhea's party and captured the moment when her daughter grabbed her face and said 'best mummy,' finding recognition for her efforts.
rationales.hedonism: She poured herself hidden wine and sat on the balcony with her feet up for forty-five minutes of nothing — declaring 'it was the best part of my week' and recognizing she needs 'moments that belong to me.'
rationales.self_direction: She created her own private moment of solitude without asking permission, taking the wine she'd hidden and claiming time for herself after the party.
rationales.benevolence: She organized and executed the party, took sixty photos, and received Rhea's 'best mummy' declaration — fully present for her daughter's joy.

rationales.self_direction: When Anil said they should hold off on big expenses, she 'agreed because what else would I say,' surrendering her own preferences without even voicing an alternative.
rationales.benevolence: She spent three days nursing Aarav through a stomach bug, washing sheets, making khichdi, and checking his temperature while managing Rhea's school schedule.
rationales.conformity: She immediately agreed to Anil's financial caution about the restructuring, cleaned up the biryani containers alone after he fell asleep, and maintained the household without complaint.
rationales.security: She supported Anil's decision to hold off on big expenses given the company restructuring, prioritizing financial stability during uncertainty.

rationales.achievement: Her blog traffic dropped forty percent and she has an unfinished draft post, reflecting her sense that the blog has gone from 'proof I still had a brain' to 'another thing I am failing at.'
rationales.self_direction: She thought about writing the blog post but the pressure cooker whistled and Rhea needed help, and the moment passed — she's unable to carve out time for her own creative pursuits.
rationales.benevolence: She took both kids to the park, clapped for Rhea's monkey bar achievement, and let Aarav sit and read his comic, attending to each child's individual needs.

rationales.achievement: She renewed insurance, bumped up coverage, and finished and published the paneer tikka blog post at 11 PM — completing practical and personal goals in the same day.
rationales.hedonism: She made butter chicken using her grandmother's recipe and both kids asked for seconds, savoring the satisfaction of a meal well-made and enjoyed by everyone.
rationales.self_direction: She sat down after the kids went to bed and finished the blog post on her own initiative, reclaiming her creative output — 'nothing fancy, but it is out there.'
rationales.benevolence: She renewed Aarav's accident cover for his upcoming football classes and increased family health insurance, protecting her family proactively.
rationales.tradition: She cooked her grandmother's butter chicken recipe with the kasuri methi at the end, preserving and passing down the family's culinary heritage.
rationales.security: She bumped up health insurance to ten lakhs after hearing about Anil's colleague's surgery and renewed Aarav's accident cover, strengthening the family's safety net.
